definition: unattainable/far-fetched/out of reach/exceedingly remote or distant
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: Derided the crowd you and I, and the distant and love.
sentences.chinese: 人群冲散了我和你，以及那遥不可及的爱情。

sentences.english: But I am a little afraid that it is just an unreachable dream.
sentences.chinese: 但我还是有一点害怕，害怕这只是一个遥不可及的梦。

sentences.english: And that would never have been possible even just a couple of years ago.
sentences.chinese: 即使仅仅几年前这恐怕都是遥不可及的梦。

sentences.english: Chollima's chances of winning might be as mythical as the horse of their name.
sentences.chinese: 千里马球队获胜的希望就像他的名字一样遥不可及。

sentences.english: Like Crescent Moon-like, distant land hanging in the air.
sentences.chinese: 象月牙儿般，遥不可及地悬挂在空中。

sentences.english: But Dr. Kidwell says medication may be out of reach for many people.
sentences.chinese: 但医生说基德韦尔药物可能是许多人遥不可及。

sentences.english: My fantasy is just a distant dream. i-bing. cn.
sentences.chinese: 我的幻想只是一个遥不可及的梦。

sentences.english: But the promised "clean break" from the past is not - yet - out of reach.
sentences.chinese: 不过他所承诺的与过去”一刀两断“并非遥不可及。

sentences.english: With wages soaring in China, that may not be a pipe dream.
sentences.chinese: 随着中国工资飞速上涨，这也许不再是遥不可及的梦。

sentences.english: It was all very far-fetched, but the footballer part has come true.
sentences.chinese: 都是些很遥不可及的想法，但足球运动员这点成真了。

sentences.english: That guarantee is near impossible for most patients.
sentences.chinese: 而那担保书对许多病人来说几乎是遥不可及的。

sentences.english: KirsYou are my sunshine , Is my distant light.
sentences.chinese: 吴亦凡你是我的太阳，是我遥不可及的光。

sentences.english: Dreamy Yao cannot reach the heart that makes her more empty, disregard the love of handkerchief.
sentences.chinese: 梦想遥不可及令她的心灵更加空虚，无视帕的爱意。

sentences.english: With life often limited by rules and restrictions freedom for women was a rare commodity.
sentences.chinese: 她们的一生常常受制于礼数教条，自由遥不可及。

definition: in sight but unattainable (idiom)/inaccessible/also written 可望而不可及[ke3 wang4 er2 bu4 ke3 ji2]
pinyin: ke3 wang4 er2 bu4 ke3 ji2
ke3 wang4 er2 bu4 ke3 ji2

definition: too high to reach (idiom); eminent and unapproachable
unreal/illusory/imaginary/vague and with nothing in it
right under one's nose/right in front of one's eyes/close at hand/imminent
far in the indefinite future (idiom); so far away it seems forever
an extravagant hope/to have excessive expectations
to yearn for/to look forward to
